intro: Arpophyllum cardinale, commonly known as the golden wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces pods that contain seeds. It is often found in woodland and open habitats across southeastern Australia. The golden wattle is also the national floral emblem of Australia, symbolizing the country's natural heritage.
